channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from multiple RSS sources, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Seeing Greene: Are Home Warranties Worth It & When to Pay Off Debt vs. Invest?
item.description: Should you pay off debt or invest? Many online financial gurus would tell you in a heartbeat that paying off debt is the number one priority…but is that always true? […]

item.title: Amazon launches a new grocery delivery subscription in the US
item.description: Amazon said today that it has launched a new grocery delivery subscription for Prime members and customers with an EBT card (Electronic Benefit Transfer) in the U.S. if you’re living in one of the 3,500 eligible cities and towns. The company started testing grocery delivery in three locations last year: Denver, Colorado; Sacramento, California; and […] © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: The Enduring Use of Solitary, and New Proposed Limits That Will Likely Fail (Again)
item.description: Isolation’s damaging effects are widely known. But many facilities confine people — even youth — virtually all day, sometimes in shower stalls.

item.title: Are 'Man Vans' Coming to a Parking Lot Near Your Soon?
item.description: "Game Changer Vehicles" – mobile medical units in a roving RV – are helping to bring cancer screening to where it's needed.

item.title: Don’t Overlook This When Buying an Investment Property—Learn From My Mistake
item.description: Let’s get one thing straight: Real estate investing isn't a get-rich-quick scheme. If you think you can just waltz in and start raking in cash without a solid game plan, you're setting yourself up for a financial face-plant.

item.title: Mozilla finds that most dating apps are not great guardians of user data
item.description: Dating apps are not following great privacy practices and are collecting more data than ever in order to woo GenZ users, a new study by Mozilla pointed out. Researchers reviewed dating apps in terms of privacy in 2021. In the latest report, they noted that dating apps have become more data-hungry and intrusive. The organization studied […] © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: Officials Failed to Act When COVID Hit Prisons. A New Study Shows the Deadly Cost.
item.description: People in prison died at 3.4 times the rate of the free population, with the oldest hit hardest. New data holds lessons for preventing future deaths.

item.title: Chronic Spontaneous Urticaria: What to Know
item.description: What you should know about chronic spontaneous urticaria (CSU), including symptoms, triggers, treatment, and a link to autoimmune disease.

item.title: Should You Invest for Cash Flow or Appreciation? Let’s Reevaluate in an Era of High Interest Rates
item.description: For real estate investors, the question of cash flow versus appreciation is as old as time. However, in an era of high interest rates, buying properties for cash flow isn’t easy. That doesn’t mean investing should […]

item.title: Adobe claims its new image generation model is its best yet
item.description: Firefly, Adobe’s family of generative AI models, doesn’t have the best reputation among creatives. The Firefly image generation model in particular has been derided as underwhelming and flawed compared to Midjourney, OpenAI’s DALL-E 3, and other rivals, with a tendency to distort limbs and landscapes and miss the nuances in prompts. But Adobe is trying […] © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: The Parents Paying for Their Children’s Crimes
item.description: Experts warn about a wave of legal consequences for parents like the Crumbleys, while some states consider prosecutions for kids as young as 10.

item.title: CSU: What to Wear and What to Avoid
item.description: Find out what’s best to wear to prevent and manage chronic spontaneous urticaria (CSU), also called chronic hives.

item.title: Do You Think It’s a Tough Time to Invest? It’s Not When You Can Get Deals Like This
item.description: Are you sitting on the sidelines in this market? Many investors are. There’s a lot of fear and caution. But we’re not. And you don’t need to be, either. Of […]

item.title: Rivian targets gas-powered Ford and Toyota trucks and SUVs with $5,000 ‘electric upgrade’ discount
item.description: Rivian is offering discounts up to $5,000 on its EVs — and a year of free charging — to customers willing to trade in their gas-powered trucks and SUVs. The deal, which kicked off April 22, is aimed directly at some of the best-selling and most ubiquitous gas-powered trucks and SUVs on the market today, […] © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: I Had a Tough Job at My Brooklyn Jail: Keeping Men From Taking Their Own Lives
item.description: As a suicide prevention aide, I had to make sure my fellow detainees didn’t harm themselves. It was surprisingly easy to get such a complex job.

item.title: Treatment Plan for Chronic Spontaneous Urticaria
item.description: The hives of CSU can be tricky to manage. You and your doctor can try medications to ease your symptoms. But other changes might make a difference, too.

item.title: A Wave of Zoning Law Changes Could Have Huge Impacts for Investors and Housing—Here’s What You Need to Know
item.description: The U.S. is facing a housing deficit of about 3.2 million units, and the situation is especially dire in urban areas like New York. It’s one of the reasons prospective homebuyers are finding […]

item.title: UnitedHealth says Change hackers stole health data on ‘substantial proportion of people in America’
item.description: The health tech giant processes 15 billion health transactions a year, and handles health information for about half of all Americans. © 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

item.title: This Supreme Court Case on Homelessness May Limit Prisoner Rights and Expand Executions
item.description: In Grants Pass v. Johnson, a town in Oregon asks the court to reconsider what constitutes “cruel and unusual punishments.”

item.title: When the Hives of CSU Don’t Go Away on Their Own
item.description: CSU can be frustrating, but the worst part might be when the hives don’t go away on their own. New treatments can help.
